function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate monitoring of sewage networks and treatment plants can lead to delayed detection of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Delayed detection can result in the rapid spread of contagious diseases within a community.","Mitigation":"Implement continuous monitoring and real-time data collection to quickly identify and respond to outbreaks.","Technologies":"Time-integrated sampling, continuous monitoring, remote data collection, and automation of sewer networks.","People":"Community members, public health officials, and policymakers.","Owner":"Public health organizations, local governments, and technology providers."},{"Description":"Difficulty in accurately estimating the population size contributing to a sewage treatment plant can result in inaccurate calculations of the percentage of infected population.","Impact":"Inaccurate calculations can lead to misinformed decisions and resource misallocation for disease control and mitigation.","Mitigation":"Develop and implement endogenous, excreted proxy markers for per capita population estimation.","Technologies":"WBE sensors, inverse regression of qPCR cycle thresholds with known infection rates.","People":"Public health researchers, sewage treatment plant operators, and technology developers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, and technology companies."},{"Description":"Comparison of infection rates between communities using WBE monitoring data requires careful calibration and standardization procedures.","Impact":"Inconsistent or incomparable data may hinder the prioritization of resources for disease control and mitigation.","Mitigation":"Standardize monitoring methods and data analysis processes across communities, and use calibration procedures such as inverse regression of qPCR cycle thresholds with known infection rates.","Technologies":"WBE sensors, data analysis software, and calibration tools.","People":"Public health professionals, data analysts, and policymakers.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and government agencies."}]}
